alert.note: Alert for Ventura (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 14 at 1:19AM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 AM PST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest California, including the following area, Ventura County. * WHEN...Until 715 AM PST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 109 AM PST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated moderate to heavy rain falling across the area. Rain is mainly focused over the western portion but will progress eastward through the overnight hours. Rainfall rates between 0.25 and 0.50 inch will be likely, locally up to 0.75 inch per hour in the mountains. This will cause urban and small stream flooding, especially in low-lying areas. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Oxnard, Thousand Oaks, Simi Valley, Ventura, Camarillo, Fillmore, Ojai, and Lockwood Valley. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
